isis.stitle: HYDRO-MAX II BRAKE MONITOR SYSTEM - TROUBLESHOOTING

step1.para: If the hydraulic brake switch (50) or the stop light switch (51) assembly is severely out of adjustment, its contacts will not open up when the brake pedal is released. This will cause the 14±5 second time limit to be exceeded, and the brake warning light and alarm to latch on. This problem is detectable by either the brake lights remaining on due to the adjustment of switch (51), or the Hydro-Max motor continuing to run (when key switch is on and engine is not running) due to the adjustment of switch (50). Refer to SWITCH ADJUSTMENT, and re-adjust the switch(es).

If either the hydraulic brake switch (50) or the stop light switch (51) is severely out of adjustment, a movement or jarring of the brake pedal may cause one of the switch's contacts to remain closed for longer than the 14±5 second time limit, latching on the brake warning light and alarm. Refer to SWITCH ADJUSTMENT, and re-adjust switch or switches.

If the master cylinder is allowed to become low on fluid in one of its halves, has a failure in one of its halves, or if air gets into the system, the differential pressure valve spool will move and close the switch contacts. This will activate the motor, and the monitor will activate the warning light and alarm. If the valve spool contains a burr, it might prevent the spool from returning to its centered position when the problem is corrected. Thus the warning light and alarm do not reset when the key switch is moved to the off position. Therefore the warning light and alarm will re-activate when the vehicle is started. Refer to standard procedures for refilling and bleeding air from hydraulic brake systems.

If a poor ground is present at the taillights of the vehicle, when the headlight or parking lights are turned on, power may feed through the brake light bulb and circuits 70B and 90R to the brake monitor module (49) pin H. This will fool the monitor into thinking that only one brake switch is functioning, thus latching on the warning light and alarm. Another indication of this problem may be the shutting off of cruise control or PTO operations when the lights are switched on.
